attributes.action: To keep daily prayers in House of Commons, as UK was built on Christian values.
attributes.additional_details: The main prayer asks for God's guidance that MPs "never lead the nation wrongly through love of power, desire to please, or unworthy ideals".
attributes.background: An MP is calling for the practice of saying prayers at the beginning of parliamentary business in the Commons to be abolished.

government_response.details:
The provision of Parliamentary Prayers is a matter for the House. However, many Members of all faiths appreciate the opportunity for quiet reflection before making important decisions during debates and the course of the parliamentary day. 

Over recent years Parliament has made many inclusive reforms. One of these is the creation of a multi-faith prayer room in January 2018. The room is non-denominational and accessible to people of all faiths and of no faith. It provides a space for individual contemplation and/or prayer.

Leader of the House of Commons
government_response.summary: The provision of Parliamentary Prayers is a matter for the House of Commons.
